decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw through the entire deck and win the game with Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac. The deck utilizes cards like Pentad Prism and Lotus Bloom to ramp up mana quickly, while controlling the game with counterspells like Pact of Negation. The deck also includes cards like Spoils of the Vault and Sleight of Hand to search for combo pieces efficiently. The goal is to execute the combo as fast as possible while ensuring protection from disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with artifact creatures and using various anthem effects to buff them up, such as Master of Etherium and Steel Overseer. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Arcbound Ravager and Signal Pest, while also having ways to protect them, like Welding Jar. With Cranial Plating providing additional power boosts and reach, the deck aims to end the game swiftly with a combination of evasive damage from creatures like Vault Skirge and Inkmoth Nexus, along with burn spells like Galvanic Blast.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Spirit creatures that work together to control the board and deal fast damage. By utilizing cards like Collected Company to quickly put multiple creatures into play, as well as disruptive creatures like Spell Queller and Rattlechains, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Selfless Spirit and Drogskol Captain also help protect the team and ensure longevity in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient Spirit creatures like Spell Queller, Supreme Phantom, and Mausoleum Wanderer, all backed up by powerful anthems like Drogskol Captain. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Rattlechains to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of flying, evasive creatures. The inclusion of Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise helps ramp into these threats quickly, while cards like Selfless Spirit provide protection for the team.

This deck focuses on dealing fast and consistent damage to the opponent through low cost spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to overwhelm the opponent early on with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells, while Skullcrack can prevent them from gaining life. Boros Charm provides versatility with its different modes, and Searing Blaze helps control the board while dealing damage. Ultimately, the goal is to win the game quickly through aggressive plays and burn spells.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to generate mana and tutor for key pieces in order to create powerful combos. By utilizing cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and win the game with a variety of win conditions. The inclusion of cards like Eldritch Evolution and Chord of Calling allows for flexibility in finding the right creature for the situation. Additionally, the deck includes disruption and protection elements to ensure the combo can be executed successfully.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to control the board and deal heavy damage to the opponent quickly. Using cards like Death's Shadow, Gurmag Angler, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang alongside disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to control the game while lowering its own life total to power up Death's Shadow. By efficiently disrupting the opponent's game plan and applying pressure with large threats, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans by imposing taxes on their resources while deploying aggressive creatures to apply pressure. By utilizing cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter to disrupt opponents' mana base, along with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Restoration Angel, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Lightning Bolt and Pia and Kiran Nalaar provides additional reach and removal options to ensure victory in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by taxing their resources while deploying efficient threats to quickly close out the game. This Aggro-Death and Taxes archetype aims to use cards like Thalia, Arbiter, and Leonin Arbiter to slow down the opponent while utilizing Aether Vial to put creatures into play at instant speed. Cards like Flickerwisp and Restoration Angel provide additional utility and value, while Mirran Crusader and Blade Splicer offer potent beatdown potential. The deck aims to control the board and outpace the opponent with its aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Hollow One, Bloodghast, and Flamewake Phoenix, enabling early aggressive plays and recurring threats. Utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to discard and draw cards quickly to fuel delve spells like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. With a low mana curve and plenty of burn removal like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Key cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Reflector Mage provide tempo advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the tribal theme of the deck.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive human creatures with the ability to disrupt opponent's strategies through cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Additionally, the deck utilizes Aether Vial to quickly get creatures onto the battlefield and pump them up with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish. The mana base is optimized for casting humans efficiently, with cards like Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls ensuring that creatures can be played on curve. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy.

The main idea of this Modern deck is to quickly deploy creatures with the Infect ability such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck is focused on using pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to make the creatures more dangerous, while protecting them with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense. The deck also includes some interaction with removal spells like Dismember and Distortion Strike to clear the way for a lethal attack. Land choices prioritize fetching Inkmoth Nexus for additional infect threats.

The deck focuses on quickly defeating the opponent by using small, evasive creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, and boosting them with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa. Protection spells like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood help protect these creatures from removal. The goal is to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent, winning the game through infect damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of spell Pierce and Dismember, as well as additional mana from Noble Hierarch and lands like Inkmoth Nexus.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on controlling the board with a mixture of counterspells like Negate, removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God, and versatile spells like Cryptic Command. The deck also utilizes card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while also having efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix. The manabase includes a variety of dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly grinding out advantage to win the game.

The focus of this Aggro Jund deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with efficient and powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan with discard spells and removal. The deck aims to control the board by utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Liliana of the Veil, while also using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt to remove threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of strong creatures, removal, and disruption, this deck seeks to outpace and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with discard spells and removal while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Grim Flayer. The deck includes a mix of disruption, removal, and card advantage tools, providing a versatile game plan for attacking the opponent from different angles. Lingering Souls offers a resilient threat that can generate multiple bodies, and the planeswalkers provide additional value and support for the aggressive game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's resources to secure a win.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Krark-Clan Ironworks (KCI) card in order to generate large amounts of mana and bring back artifacts from the graveyard. The deck includes cards like Myr Retriever, Scrap Trawler, and Ancient Stirrings to consistently retrieve and play artifacts. These artifacts, such as Mox Opal, Pyrite Spellbomb, and Ichor Wellspring, help to fuel the KCI engine. The deck also includes cards like Engineered Explosives and Darksteel Citadel to control the board, and Inventors' Fair to search for key pieces.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures, removal spells, and hand disruption to overwhelm opponents quickly. It utilizes token generation from cards like Lingering Souls and Young Pyromancer to go wide, while also having direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to control the board. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, and finish them off with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Bedlam Reveler.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for specific creatures, while also taking advantage of cards like Vizier of Remedies and Devoted Druid to generate mana and power up other creatures. The inclusion of cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Ghost Quarter helps disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain control of the game. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and apply constant pressure to the opponent.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tireless Tracker. The deck also includes removal spells such as Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope adds versatility and additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and aggressive while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and dealing damage to the opponent through efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Soul-Scar Mage, and Snapcaster Mage, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Wizard's Lightning, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of counter spells like Remand and disruptive creatures like Nimble Obstructionist and Vendilion Clique helps to protect the game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive control elements while also utilizing the faerie creature type for synergy. By combining counterspells, removal, and efficient creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to control the game tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by recurring key spells from the graveyard, while cards like Nimble Obstructionist and Vendilion Clique offer utility and disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's spells and faerie synergy, allowing for consistency and flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations.

The focus of this deck is to generate mana quickly, draw cards efficiently, and set up Pyromancer Ascension to double key spells like Desperate Ritual and Grapeshot in order to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent in a single turn. The deck also utilizes cards like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames to recur key spells from the graveyard and maintain the combo chain. Cards like Remand and Repeal provide some interaction and protection while Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance help reduce the cost of spells and increase spell efficiency.

The deck revolves around controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through spells like Ancestral Vision and Nahiri, the Harbinger, eventually closing out the game with powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The inclusion of flexible removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with card filtering from Desolate Lighthouse, allows the deck to adapt to various matchups and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent all at once. It uses ramp spells like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow to accelerate its mana production and quickly find the necessary pieces to win the game. Primeval Titan can also help tutor for Valakut and accelerate the combo. The deck also includes some removal and card draw to help control the game until it can assemble its combo and win.
